title: Team Builder will be disabled on OCE
body:
Hey everyone,

As you know we monitor all of the queues to ensure they maintain a healthy matchmaking experience. Unfortunately we have seen the number of players in the Team Builder queue decline over time so we will be disabling the queue on Friday 9 October at 2:30 AM AEDT.

The development team are working on an improved Champion Select experience, so we may look to introduce that in the future. We'll post any updates on the boards when there is more info to share.

It’s also important to point out that this doesn't mean that another queue will take its place. All of the queues are evaluated independently and are currently in a healthy place, but they haven’t grown to the point of expansion yet.

You can see the full queue schedule in the stickied post: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/ZzQR1haM-queue-schedule

replies.body: I wish you would replace it with Normal Draft {{champion:32}}

Go get more people playing the game then. What people don't realise is that Riot cannot simply implement new queues without a large enough player base to ensure reasonable queue times across each of them

> [{quoted}](name=fattyhotdogs,realm=OCE,application-id=3fteLeTW,discussion-id=zYEl5wAp,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-10-07T05:59:29.223+0000)
>
> Go get more people playing the game then. What people don't realise is that Riot cannot simply implement new queues without a large enough player base to ensure reasonable queue times across each of them

Normal draft queue times were perfectly normal before they removed it. Theres no reason people wouldnt play it.

This, those that never played Draft prior don't understand that queues were actually extremely short compared to what teambuilder was.

10 minutes off peak was what you were looking at for a long queue.

Yeah. Riot removed Normal Draft thinking that those players would switch to that PoS TeamBuilder. The queue time for Normal Draft was already healthy, and players were content with the fact that the time in queue was a worthwhile trade-off for the sake of having a better quality match.

The only drawback to TeamBuilder is that it splits the queues, and tends to create longer queue times for carries no matter the health of the queue. NA TeamBuilder is about as healthy as JasonWazza claims OCE normal draft was, and worked so well that it was my primary queue. It was a valid if unfortunate choice to remove it when they implemented TeamBuilder, but I agree that it's probably reasonable to bring it back now that they've disabled TeamBuilder.

Tangentially, I loved that TeamBuilder motivated people to queue as support and jungle. It encouraged carry mains to diversify, and to consider not maining mid or ADC, which (if effective) would improve matchmaking experience across queues when people return to normal draft or blind pick. I don't know if it is/was as strong a motivation as I would like, but at the very least, it meant I could quickly find matches as support or jungle without having to deal with multiple people instalocking the same role, or arguing until it's too late, causing people to take their top setup into the jungle or whatever. Yes, they're morons and such self-inflicted suffering is appropriate, except that the entire team suffers, and it potentially ruins the game for all ten players.
Well make aram like TT(Twisted Treeline) or replace it with crystal scar for a trial and remove Team Builder (Which it has been) and we will be able to have normal draft pick.
ARAM is huge. Why would they remove the queue for that?
Because in aram its full of bots and reporting them isn't doing much because there are like 30 different bots in like 10 games.
you must have a horrid aram mmr to be playing with bots. after about lvl 20 on a smurf i didnt see anymore bots on aram and i got matched with silvers+

I duo/trio with lower level friends who don't like this game as much, since they prefer Dota2. My MMR for aram isn't high it's around the middle, but its probably low because I duo/trio with lower level Summoners.
This isn't a satisfactory solution to the problem, but sooner or later you will pull your friends out of that range and never have to deal with bots again. Just keep reporting them for now.
sage
& yet how can they grow when they remove/limit people's favourite modes???
I logged in just to say I would play normal draft mode over regular normals anyday
normal draft is coming. now the problem is, hoping people understand pick order > call order (or vice versa, i cant remember the terms tbh)
Normal Draft Mode please :)
Dominion PLEEASE

You know if you promote it as your primary queue instead of Blind Pick it would get way more players. 
I feel like you just put it there hoping people would stumble into it. Teambuilder is better than Blind Pick in basically every single way, why not just delete Blind Pick and promote Teambuilder as the best one you have? 

IMO, not enough encouragement from the client for players to queue for TB. Free IP would be one way to go about it.
Or give everyone draft like we want.

Lol at one point Teambuilder was the only queue available to under level 25's and you know what happened? No one played it still and new players stopped playing after 2 days. That changed very quickly when it became obvious Teambuilder being the only queue is a huge mistake. TB has had tons of encouragement, summoner icons, bonuses, better times than any other introduced queue. The reality is people like blind pick, no matter how much Riot throws incentives in the way of Teambuilder, which they definitely have. Now imagine if they did that for draft. IMO too much time and commitment went into trying to get people to queue for TB when they just didn't want to.

That's bullshit. 
Who in their right mind would pick Blind Pick champ select over TB champ select?

>All of the queues are evaluated independently and are currently in a healthy place

Just as a point, how can you evaluate Normal drafts and tell us that it won't work?

Put it on for a week, and if it has hour long queues then maybe i'll believe you, but i think you guys at Riot OCE are just flat out making wrong assumptions.

EDIT: and if you want to see the publics opinion on normal draft, put a thing in client and make a poll on boards asking how often people would play normal draft.
Will this mean that we won't get Ranked Team Builder when it comes out either?

If I remember correctly Lyte said somewhere that Ranked Team Builder will be replacing the current Ranked experience when it comes out, so unless suddenly we don't have enough people for a ranked queue at all then we should still get that when it finally happens.

Give us back normal draft then, this server is nigh-unplayable. 

If you guys weren't on a micro-transaction based model do you know how many refunds you'd have to give out based on how hard you've screwed your customer base, taking almost all the modes out of the game?

What remove team builder cause ts got no people in it? Maybe if you got rid of blind pick and just had team builder then more people would play it? Blind pick is toxic, people instalock and don't respect calls if you some wants to troll you have to dodge or have to deal with a shit game.
Blind pick may have trolls but at lest they aren't looking for a jungle Nami or a mage Udyr or support Yasuo. In the recommended section.

Team builder has less people because it is in direct competition with blind pick. There were essentially 2 queues for the same thing but one had 30+ minute wait times. I would've loved for team builder to be a viable option. While it was populated it cut down (reasonably significantly) on the trolling, flaming, dodges and those trying to force a dodge timer onto others. Its implementation alongside its main competitor without disabling one or the other, even for a trial, was a poor decision.  

Champion select can be highly volatile and you're just as likely to get a team that communicates as you are to encounter a fight. This behavior is enabled by the fact that no one wants to spend at least 20 minutes (potentially a full game with a duo) with the guy intentionally feeding just to send a report off in the post game.
